criteria: Knowledge of Basic First Aid Procedures
descriptions: Does not recognize or identify any emergency situations.
Identifies an emergency situation, but hesitates or misinterprets the situation.
Identifies common emergency situations with prompting.
Confidently identifies most common emergency situations.
Quickly and accurately identifies a wide range of emergency situations.
Demonstrates expert-level recognition of complex or unusual emergency scenarios.
Demonstrates no knowledge of basic first aid procedures.
Shows minimal awareness of first aid, but cannot describe any procedures.
Describes basic first aid steps with significant inaccuracies or omissions.
Describes and sequences basic first aid steps for common injuries/illnesses.
Accurately explains first aid procedures and can adapt them to different scenarios.
Demonstrates comprehensive knowledge, including advanced techniques and modifications for special populations (e.g., infants, elderly).
Unable to apply any emergency procedures, even with guidance.
Attempts to apply a procedure but does so incorrectly and ineffectively.
Applies basic procedures with assistance and some errors.
Independently and correctly applies common emergency procedures.
Applies emergency procedures effectively, adapting to the specific situation.
Expertly applies and adapts procedures in complex or stressful situations, ensuring optimal outcomes.
Cannot communicate effectively during simulated emergencies.
Communicates poorly, providing unclear or incomplete information.
Communicates basic information with prompting.
Clearly and concisely communicates essential information to others.
Communicates effectively, providing reassurance and clear instructions.
Demonstrates exceptional communication skills, coordinating efforts and delegating tasks effectively under pressure.
